(embarrassed) Marblehead... (she chuckles) What. .?  65.

Come on, Charlie...I love Marblehead too, but...it’s like the song says... (smiles, shakes her head) You can’t buy a thrill... Charlie’s looking right at her, into those sea-green eyes And Tess is feeling it too...thinking maybe you can buy a thrill, after all...Then...

Umm...we need more wine... Charlie gets up and heads off into the kitchen. Tess watches him go. She smiles, still not sure what to m of him. Then she gets up, stretches out...and gravitates toward the big, messy bookcase. It’s filled with an eclec assortment- everything from World Lit to Archeology to bo on all matters related to the afterlife. But it’s a certa sailing book that gets her attention, it’s lying beneath cardboard box on the top shelf. She reaches for it, tryin slide it out from beneath the box. But the box falls and contents spill onto the floor -

We see splashes of images, young Charlie, Sam and their mother... INT. CHARLIE’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Charlie’s trying to get a bottle of wine open with the corkscrew. But his hand is trembling with nerves. He chastises himself...
Get a grip...

Charlie walks in with the wine bottle. Tess doesn’t see h she’s seated on the floor, looking at a photo of a young Charlie with his mother. Charlie doesn’t like being confronted with these long ago images...But he covers it he says:
That’s my mom. Tess looks up, startled.  66.
Charlie, I’m sorry, I was reaching for a book and-
It’s okay... He bends down and starts putting the pictures back.
When my mom moved up to Portland, we divi’d up the family photos...

I guess, you’re not the album type... (holding a photo) You and...Sam, right? CLOSE ON PHOTO - YOUNG CHARLIE AND SAM, arms around each other, aboard their sailboat, mugging for the camera. Cha has to hide his pain.
We were out at the point... And Charlie quickly starts tossing the photos back into t box. But Tess is fascinated by them. Picture after pictur Sam and Charlie sailing...
Charlie? Was Sam the reason?
The reason for what?
The reason you stopped sailing. Charlie just looks at her. She sure can press his buttons
I’m sorry. I-
It’s all right... (then, after a beat...) Sam and me...we were gonna sail around the world, too.
(delighted) You were?  And Charlie just starts talking, as if in a dream...

Marquesas, Tuamoto, Zanzibar, Fiji...all of those faraway places that hang off the edge of the map by their fingernails...we were gonna see ‘em all... (then) After the accident...I tried taking the boat out a few times but... (he shakes his head) 67. Charlie’s never said these things to anybody. Tess takes hand.
When I lost my dad...I thought I’d never get over it. (gently) But we’ve gotta keep going, Charlie... Tess looks deep into Charlie’s eyes...
“Trust your heart if the seas catch fire..” (then) You’ve got to take a chance... Then, almost imperceptibly, Charlie leans toward her. barely whispers:
What are you..?

Taking a chance... Then, in the grip of emotions he’s never before felt, pulls her into his arms...and kisses her with all the .-Tess Charlie passion, longing and tenderness...that his lonely heart contains. Then it’s over. Both of them overwhelmed and unprepared f the powerful emotions coursing through them.
Timing is everything, isn’t it?
What do you-  68.
I’m leaving in a week, remember? Charlie nods grimly. Then...
I oughtta go...
Can I walk you? Let me-

(she touches his cheek) Good night, Charlie St. Cloud... And Tess walks out the door. Charlie’s cottage has never seemed so empty, and his heart is aching. Then... A knock at the door. Charlie opens it. Tess lands in his arms. They’re kissing passionately...Bumping into furnitu tearing off clothes as they make their way into the bedro INT. CHARLIE’S BEDROOM - DAWN Charlie’s just stirring. He sits up sleepily and looks around. He’s alone. He’s surprised, dismayed...And then h sees, taped to his mirror-

Tess at the Tiller. She calls out to him:
(smiling) I knew you’d find me... Charlie starts walking slowly toward the water.

Oh, come on, Charlie...what are you waiting for? And she holds out her hand.

WHOOSH! CLOSE ON: The bow of the little sailboat carving across the bay. PULL BACK: Charlie is at the tiller, Tess works the mains and jib ropes. They are sailing the boat hard, into a fre north-east wind. For Charlie...the sensation of being out on the water again...is one of just pure, unadulterated...joy, and he’ having the time of his life.
Yeeeha! Then...
The wind’s picking up. Standby to let out the main!
Aye, aye, Cap... Charlie’s having the time of his life. He smiles at Tess, knowing he’s got her to thank for this. She smiles back.

Let’s go out again tomorrow. We can-
Sure, and next time I’1l give you a few pointers on how to-
(laughs) Oh, you will..?  70. Tess laughs. Charlie just looks at her. Then he kisses he
Thank you. Tess just smiles. Then:
I’ve got a million things to do before next week...
Sure... She kisses him. Then:
We can meet here for lunch. Right after Aunt Abby.
, (laughs ) Who? And off she goes. Charlie watches her. He’s got the bigge smile on his face...
Charlie’s still wearing that smile as he hoses off a gravestone. Joe’s with him, laughing.
Dumbass grin can only mean one thing...Sonavabitch...Who is she? Give it up, Charlie, or I’‘ll- And Charlie laughingly turns the hose on him. Joe laughs he runs away.
Tess’s AUNT ABBY, an ancient gal in her eighties, sits staring out of the window. Tess walks in. She smiles sadly. Then she comes over and gives her aunt a kiss.
Hey, Aunt Abby...You look pretty today. Aunt Abby just stares off, Tess’s presence not registerin  71.
Whatcha looking at? That sparrow? There’s a sparrow on a limb right outside the window. He flies off.

There he goes... (then she smiles) Aunt Abby...? Aunt Abby, I met somebody. His name is Charlie and he’s a sailor like me...You’d like him, Aunt Abby, he’s very sweet...but he’s very sad... (whispers) Don’t tell mom, but I kinda let him get to first base last night. Actually, he got a little bit further than-
Tess..? Tess is startled. She comes around to face her aunt.
Aunt Abby...
Are you all right, dear?
(laughs) I’m fine. I’m great...I’m...
It’s okay, dear. Everything’s going to be all right, and I’1l see you very soon. And then Aunt Abby’s eyes close, her head tilts and she’s snoring softly. Tess smiles, kisses her cheek.
Charlie and Tess sit on a blanket with a now empty picnic basket beside them. You can tell that they’ve been here f hours.
It’s the first time she’s spoken to me in months. I think it’s a sign of something...Something good.  72.
(smiles ) It’s a sign that you’re gonna win the race. Tess smiles tentatively:
Or a sign that you’re gonna say, yes, to what I’m gonna ask you... Charlie smiles, kisses her neck.
Ask me anything. Whatever it is...whatever you want...
Will you meet me in Cape Town? Charlie’s just looking at her. What..?
The first leg of the race...that’s where it ends.
Tess, I...
Will you, Charlie? Please, it would just be so great... She’s waiting for an answer. Charlie’s tormented.
Tess, I just...I...
I know it’s crazy, Charlie, I know we just met but...
The startled Charlie goes white.
What’s wrong? Charlie can barely control his panic.
I have to get back...  73. And they’re hurrying to his truck.

It’s...the sprinklers. The timer’s all haywire and the whole place is about to get drenched... EXT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - SUNSET They get out of the pickup. Charlie’s already off and running, prevailing on Tess:
This won’t take long... Tess looks after him, curiously.
Charlie breathlessly crashes into the glade.
(shouts ) Sam? Sam, are you here? Sam... And then Charlie just stands there, frozen...
Oh, my God...
And Sam’s frightened, quivering, nearly in tears.
You broke the promise, Charlie...You broke the promise... Charlie rushes over to his brother, tries to touch him... his hand passes through.
(anguished) Don’t go, Sam. You gotta try to hang on.
I don’t know if I can. It might be too late...
Why weren’t you here, Charlie? Why weren't you- Then...lighting up relieved...

You’re doing it, Sam. See? You’re coming back...It’s gonna be okay... And, sure enough, Sam’s becoming more visible. Charlie ca grab Sam’s arm now, his hand no longer passes through. Bu Sam’s still angry and distraught.
Where the hell were you?
I’m so sorry, Sam. I-
It's Tess, isn’t it, Charlie? That’s why you’re late. You'd rather be with-
No. No...It’ll never happen again, Sam...I swear to God...You’re my brother and I’m not gonna lose you.
Maybe you better tell her... Charlie turns around. There’s Tess.
I didn’t mean to spy on you... Charlie is mortified.

Charlie, it’s okay. I talk to my dad all the time. (nods toward sea) When I was out there, he was with me. As sure as Sam’s here now. Now Charlie glances toward Sam, who is obviously feeling threatened...  75.
I made him a promise that...I’d always take care of him.
I get it, Charlie, I really do... Charlie just looks at her, he really does want her to understand...
We didn’t have a dad like yours. It was my job to protect him...
(smiles ) I’m sure you were a great big brother. He was lucky to have you. Tess comes over to Charlie and takes his hand. She raises to her lips and gently kisses it.
(gently) Let’s go.
Where?
Your place. We were talking about Cape Town, remember? The frightened Sam cries out.
Charlie, no!
Cape Town...
Don’t go, Charlie! Please!
Tess...
Remember our promise.
I know we just met...But, Charlie...I want to be with you...  76. Charlie tears his eyes away from Tess. He looks at his frightened, little brother...Then to Tess:
I can’t just take off whenever I feel like it...I have a job...
I’m sure your job will still be here...and besides...aren’t you the boss?
(sheepish) I’ve got a lot going on. It’s hard to explain... Tess sighs sadly. And starts walking away.
It’s okay...you don’t have to...
Tess, wait...
You’re right...We barely even know each other... And she starts walking off. Sam smiles. Charlie goes afte her, stops her.
Tess, please-
I’ve got a race to get ready for...
It’s not that I don’t want to. I'd go if I could...
Then what is it? What’s keeping you here? Charlie looks at Tess, he’s going to tell her...Then he glances at Sam, frightened, waiting...nearly quaking with fear.
Good luck with your race, Tess. Good luck with everything...  77. Tess’s heart is broken. Then she turns and walks away. Sa comes up beside his brother.
I love you, bro... Charlie just looks at Sam. He’s made his choice and he’1l live with it. He throws his arm around Sam.
I love you too... EXT. TESS’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - NIGHT A single light burns high up in the widow’s walk of an eighteenth century house overlooking the harbor. Tess walks in, looks around, calls out:
Mom? But the house is empty. Tess sighs and plops down in the window seat of the widow’s walk, gazes mournfully out ove the dark water. Bobbo, trots in. He whines pitifully. Tess sighs.
Yep Bobo, you got it in one... INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE ON: Charlie. He smiles.

I can’t come to Cape Town, because every evening I play ball with my dead brother in the cemetery - (intensely cheerful) Of course I’m not crazy! PULL BACK: Charlie, sitting drinking alone, is talking to thin air. Suddenly engulfed by sadness, his smile fades. murmurs. CHARLIE (cont'd) Really... I’m not... Charlie gulps scotch from the glass in his hand.  78. EXT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - DAWN Charlie, looking like hell and feeling even worse, is jus now discovering that he’s out of coffee. He shakes out th few remaining grounds from the bag...
Shit... Then...a knock at the door. Tess? Charlie rushes to open Joe's standing there with a shit eating grin.
It’s Mary Dempsey, you’re doing, ain’t it?
I don’t even know Mary... Charlie closes the door in Joe’s face and turns away. Joe opens the door and comes inside.
(calls out) Yo! Mar-eee...
There’s nobody here... Then he looks at Charlie, realizes for the first time how disheveled he is.
You sure do look like a night with Mary Dempsey...
I just...need some coffee...
(notices empty bag ) Damn...no woman and no coffee...Now, that’s messed up...
INT. TESS’S MOM’S HOUSE - DAY Tess is walking toward Bobo with a leash.
Come on, boy, let’s go fora walk...  79. Bobo gets up and rushes past Tess, right out through the doggie door.
Hey!
A rustic little dive on the water. The place filled up wi early morning regulars. Charlie’s thoughts are miles away he sits with Joe and sips his coffee. Joe talks to waitre
(to waitress) What’s up, Loretta? How’s the kids?

(sour) I got one with his arm busted and two down with chickenpox. Thank you for asking... Charlie glances out the window and notices Tink hurrying along the dock. He meets a couple of other watermen.
Tess runs down the beach, chasing Bobo. Up ahead, she see FISHERMAN she knows. She calls out:
Hey, Dubby, grab him, will you? Dubby makes no attempt to stop the dog and as Tess runs b she laughs:
Thanks for nothing, Dubby...
Charlie’s still watching as Tink and the group enter the and go to a big wall-sized nautical chart of the area. A couple of the locals drift over and join the group.

So what‘ll it be, guys? Charlie gets up and approaches Tink’s group. As he nears huddle he hears snatches of conversation: “Coast Guard chopper could...” “been over forty-eight hours since...” “where was your last contact from?...”  80. Through the window we see a distressed Grace Carroll walk with HODDY SNOW, the officious-looking harbor master.
Tess chases Bobo, who’s now heading toward town. She’s getting seriously irritated.
Goddamnit, Bobo...
Charlie steps into the group.
What’s going on?
There’s a boat missing, Charlie. CLOSE ON: Charlie. Almost instinctively he asks:
Which boat?
Tess calls to a young woman walking along the pavement.
Hey Julie, Bobo’s gone crazy...! JULIE looks through Tess as if she doesn’t exist.
The Water Man’s battling his emotions.
The Querencia...Tess Carroll’s boat. Charlie is in shock. Some of the locals overhear and leav their tables to join the throng at the map.
Tess, irritated, speaks directly into Julie’s face.
Julie...  81. No response. Tess turns to a mirrored storefront window, seeking her reflection...
Charlie is reeling. This just can’t be... The men in the group make way for Grace Carroll, who’s ju walked in. Her face is tear-streaked as she makes her way through the crowd.
(to Tink) The Coast Guard doesn’t have a man to spare. It seems there are some fishing boats in trouble... Finally, Charlie just has to speak up.
This is a mistake. All eyes are on him. Tink looks at him disdainfully:
How the hell would you know, St. Cloud?
Tess isn’t missing. I was with her yesterday. Everybody’s befuddled. What’s going on here..?
You were with my daughter?
Yes, ma’am, I was. We had dinner together and a picnic and-

(scowling) She hasn’t been seen or heard from in over forty-eight hours. She’s out there somewhere. She never came back... PUSH IN: On Charlie desperately holding back fear. Everybody, including Joe, is shaking their heads, thinking...crazy Charlie again.  82.
We now see what Tess sees in the mirror -- life continuin around her on the street, but no reflection back of herse Gripped with panic, Tess slowly buckles to the pavement.
Charlie still reeling as Tink addresses the group.
Anybody with a boat, please... We can use all the help we can get.
(to Charlie) What about you? Why don’t you make yourself useful and-
(dazed) You're too late... Everybody’s aghast. Charlie turns and walks out the door.
Charlie’s rushing down the street, looking in all directi No sign of Tess. Then he has a thought. He takes off towa the water. Soon...up ahead...he sees her.
Her back to Charlie, gazing out at the water.
Tess! Tess turns around. There’s Charlie rushing toward her. An less than a moment, she’s in his arms.
Charlie, thank God...I thought I was going crazy or...
(anguished) Tess—  83.
Nobody can see me, Charlie. Nobody but you... Tess can tell by Charlie’s face that something is horribl wrong.
Tell me what’s happening...Tell me I’m real... Charlie knows he has to be strong for her. It isn’t easy. A procession of boats motor past the dock on their way ou the harbor.
(gently) They’re going out to search for you.
Search for me..? But...
When you went out on your test run...you ran into that storm front...Do you remember what happened? And Tess tries her best to concentrate...
I lied to Tink about my position... I remember asking my dad for help and then...the next thing I knew...I was there at his grave... Charlie’s having a hard time holding it together.
(hardest words he’s ever spoken) When you went out on the Querencia...you didn’t come back. Tess is thunderstuck. She starts shaking her head.
What..? No...that’s...  84.
Tess...I can see you...because I can see Sam. Then finally, an anguished cry...
I am not dead!...
Tess...
I have a whole life to live. I want to sail. (imploring) I want to love. They look into each other’s eyes...Charlie’s heart is breaking. And then...Tess begins to slowly fade...
No...
I’m so cold...why am I so..? Tess panics as she realizes what’s happening to her.
Tess, hang on...
Find me, Charlie... Charlie tries to hold onto Tess, but his hands go right through her. Their faces are inches apart. Tess’s voice i drifting far away.
Tess, please-
Come find me... And then...she’s gone.

No... Tink passes with his boat. He’s seen Charlie talking to himself. He turns away with disgust.  85. Charlie’s left alone on the dock, the mournful foghorn blows... INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - DAY Charlie’s wall...with it’s meticulous round trip charts a sunset tables and dozens of sailboat sketches. PULL BACK TO: Charlie standing there, staring at them.. Then, in a rage he rips the charts from the wall, tearing them into pieces and flinging them across the room. Next his sailboat sketches - one after another, he rips them f the wall. But there’s one sailboat sketch that stops him

It’s the sketch of Charlie’s re-imagined version of Tess’ boat. Charlie can’t bring himself to pull this one from t wall but the sight of it absolutely breaks his heart. * Then he calms down, composes himself...He knows what he h to do... INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - LATE AFTERNOON Charlie’s at his desk, writing a letter. CLOSE ON LETTER - All we see are the words: “DEAR MOM, I’M SORRY FOR EVERYTHING...” And- “NOW I’LL BE WITH SAM...” And we are led to the inescapable conclusion that Charlie Cloud is planning to take his life...Then...there’s a kno on the door. Charlie ignores it, or tries to. Then-
Open up, Charlie, I know you’re in there. You gotta knock off the crazy shit, Charlie! * Charlie grits his teeth...
Outside pounding on the door.
We got a six P.M. service, and * we're short on crew.  86.
He grimaces. He knows Joe’s not leaving. He barks:
I’ll be right there... He stashes his suicide letter in the desk drawer, closes

We thank you Lord for the life of a great man. We are grateful for his devotion to a fireman’s duty, for his dedication to the preservation of life, etc... In the distance, the sunset cannon booms. Charlie hears i He starts toward the woods.
Charlie plops down miserably on a log, waiting for Sam. T a voice...
Charlie. He turns around. It’s Florio Ferrente in his dress unifor
Charlie St. Cloud.
(stands up) Yeah. .?
(warm smile) It’s been a long time, Charlie...Thirteen years...
I’m sorry, I...  87.
June 9th, ‘95. Bridge Street and Flint. Charlie is rocked. He remembers now.
I’m sorry I didn’t recognize you... Florio approaches Charlie and somewhat awkwardly embraces in a gentle hug.
It’s so good to see you again...I’m Florio, by the way. Florio Ferrente. Then Charlie nods in the direction of the funeral.
So how did you..?
Apartment fire over in Revere...Little girl saved her kitty, I saved the little girl...but no one saved me...
I’m sorry.
It’s the job. I wouldn’t have it any other way. (Charlie nods) I’ve thought about you over the years...I’ve thought about you a lot...
You have?
Twenty seven years on the job, Charlie, and you...you were my only miracle. Charlie is both profoundly moved and ashamed of himself. a
I always figured that there must have been some purpose to it...Am I right, Charlie?
I don't...
A miracle without one is just...God showing off... Florio’s looking right at him, Charlie can barely meet hi eyes. Then:
Hello. Sam has walked into the glade.
This is my brother-
(he knows ) Sam.
Do you know me?
(in Italian) “Muor giovane coluiche al cielo e caro.” (Sam’s confused) “Whom the Gods love die young.” Florio walks toward him. Looks into his eyes.
I was the one who brought your brother back. After the accident.
Oh...
I want you to know that it broke my heart, letting you go...but I could only save one of you, and Charlie had the best chance. Sam smiles. ee
You did your best...you saved Charlie. Florio smiles at Charlie:
My only miracle... Charlie is profoundly moved. And also ashamed of himself. Then...in the distance - bagpipe music.
You hear that? That’s my favorite part of the service... And Florio starts to head out of the glade back toward hi funeral service.
You have yourself a great life, Charlie. Bye, Sam... And Florio musses Sam’s hair as he heads off. Charlie and Sam watch him go.
You ever think, Sam...that maybe we made a mistake?
About what?
It seemed like such a good idea. A great idea...only now, I’m not so sure... And now Sam knows...
(rocked) Charlie...how can you-
There’s more for us, Sam, there’s got to be. Sam just looks at Charlie...Then, bitterly-  90.
I know what’s going on, here, Charlie....don’t think I don’t.
It’s not what you think...
You’re a liar, Charlie. You’re-
Sam, Tess is...dead.
(stunned) What. .?
(glances toward ocean) She went out in the storm...She’s lost at sea...
But...she was here the other day...
That was her spirit... Sam takes it in...then...
Charlie...Charlie...I’m sorry... And Sam gives Charlie a hug. Charlie looks at his little brother, realizes how great he is, how much he loves him. smiles sadly.
I’ll see you tomorrow, okay? Sam smiles with reassurance.

Okay... And Charlie walks out of the glade. INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - NIGHT Charlie walks in and surveys the mess he’s made. The only thing still on the wall is his sketch of the Querencia. Then he walks to the desk, opens the drawer - he’s lookin  gl.

He picks it up and tears it into pieces which he tosses i the trash. Then as he’s about to close the drawer...he se something in there, it was lying beneath the note...Was i there before...? He picks it up. TESS’S HAND DRAWN SAILBOAT PICTURE It breaks Charlie’s heart to see it. Then he turns it ove There are those three words again-

Charlie sighs deeply. He places the note back in the draw a memento he will forever cherish. He closes the drawer a starts picking up the tattered remains of the charts and sketches he’d torn off the wall. But he’s stopped cold when lying on the floor, he sees-

It’s identical to the other. He turns it over. Those word again... COME FIND ME... Charlie is baffled...where did this second sketch come fr And as he studies it, he hears...a sound...a ripping soun He wheels around to see-

Getting low. We can refuel and pick up some sandwiches at Portsmouth. Tink yawns mightily.
You wanna grab some sleep?
No...I’m good... EXT. OCEAN/TINK’S BOAT - DAY Tink is sound asleep. Charlie is at the tiller, scanning horizon. He can’t see shit, it’s foggy as hell...

Charlie, weary, running on fumes, still at the wheel. Now Charlie’s got his eye on-
Tink walks over, sees Charlie watching the sun. He hands a beer.
Thanks.
When that sun goes down it’s gonna be like sailing through a tunnel. Charlie’s not thinking about the darkness, he’s thinking about Sam as he says:
We’'ll find her. And we’1l be back before the sun goes down... Charlie wants to believe this with all his heart.
Tink steers toward a small island. Charlie calls out:
Tess! Tess!  96. No reply. Charlie dares to glance skyward-

text: Charlie’s getting desperate.
Head for Shark’s Bay... Tink shakes his head but he turns the wheel.
Tink’s trying the radio again. Charlie’s going over the navigational maps and charts, crossing out the areas that have already been searched.
Shark’s Bay, Pilot Rock, Boon Island, Cape Porpoise...Newburyport... (fervent) -..-That just leaves...
(frustrated) It leaves about one hundred square miles of- Charlie gets up and heads for the deck.
I know where she is.
Charlie’s at the wheel with Tink. The water’s getting rougher, the boat’s unsteady, the cold sea sweeps the dec and both men have to shout above the din of the waves.
Mingo Rock! That’s gotta be twenty miles out...
She hit some rough weather out by the shoals. Mingo Rock is the last place-
How do you know she-  97.
Because that’s what she said.
(angry laugh) That’s what she said? And when exactly did she- Charlie realizes he slipped up.
You’re gonna have to trust me on-
(ordering) Turn her around...
Tink...

We can still get back before dark... Charlie instinctively looks up at the sun. It’s starting to sink. He could still make it back for Sam. His hands are unsteady on the wheel... He turns back to Tink.
We’re not going in. Tink just snorts and makes a move toward the wheel. Charl blocks him, gets in his face.
How are you gonna feel when they find her, Tink? When they find her dead at Mingo Rock? This stops Tink. He just glares at Charlie...Then...
You’d better be right, St. Cloud... Or its gonna be you they find at Mingo Rock... Tink storms away. Charlie looks back at the sun...  98.
Charlie’s still at the wheel, staring off at the sun. He murmurs softly...
Sam...
Sam sitting on a log, waiting. He tosses his ball in the and catches it.

Charlie’s on the deck. He stares out at the big, orange s sinking into the sea. After thirteen years, and thousands sunsets, Charlie registers the enormity of his decision. then the tears start to come...

..-As the last of the sun’s light bathes it in amber... The pond, empty and still. The grassy area...vacant. And the log Sam was sitting on...He sits there no longer. Then as the CAMERA MOVES THROUGH THE GLADE...We find-
Looking out to sea...and just beginning to fade away...
Charlie, a tear streaming down his cheek as he watches th last of the sunset...
Goodbye, Sam... Then...
We should be coming up on it... Charlie turns to Tink...  99.

Yeah... CLOSE ON: The bow of Tink’s boat ploughing through the wa CUT TO: The bridge. Charlie and Tink look out in expectat as the boat rounds an island. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He silently prays as... CHARLIE’S POV: The island clears from view and.... He sig QUERENCIA’S CAPSIZED HULL. He does not know whether to feel joy or despair. Querenci wallows on the gentle swell like an upturned, bloated carcass. Wedged between two small islands, the boat’s kee partially snapped off. Tink is amazed, horrified and ecstatic.
God damn...How did you..? Snapping into action, Charlie barks at Tink.
Take the wheel... Tink grabs the wheel as Charlie starts pulling off his sh
What the hell-
Get as close as you can!

That water’s freezing. You'll kill yourself... Charlie runs to the bow of the boat. He pauses, staring a Querencia’s stricken hull. He murmurs a silent prayer. And then... WIDE: Charlie dives... UNDERWATER SHOT: An explosion of phosphorescence as Charl body shatters the silent, shimmering, underwater world.  100. He arrows down toward the inverted entrance of Querencia’ cabin. Charlie reaches the storm board which seal the cabin’s entrance. He tries to budge the board. It will not move. CLOSE ON: He struggles desperately with the board, WE HEA the sound of his blood drumming in his ears. He is runnin out of air. Turning on his back, Charlie uses his feet to kick the st board with all his might. CLOSE ON: It budges. With redoubled fury, Charlie kicks. The board slides far enough for Charlie to wriggle into the opening. FOLLOW Charlie into...

Gasping, Charlie surfaces into the air pocket of the uptu cabin. The water is chest deep. A slice of sunlight penetrates from where the keel has co away from the hull; otherwise the cabin is dark as a tomb The eerily amplified sound of the boat’s hull grinding against rocks, fills our ears. Charlie calls.

Tess? He takes the pencil light from his pocket and tears it fr its plastic wrapping. Snapping the light on, Charlie casts its beam around the cabin. Everything is literally, turned upside down. Packets of food, maps, clothing, and a mess of other junk floats in the water. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He cannot see Tess. With rising urgenc he scans the beam into every nook and cranny of the cabin CHARLIE (cont'd) Tess? Tess!  101. And then he sees her; unconscious, and almost hidden, Tes wedged into the corner of the far bulkhead. With a cry of relief, Charlie rushes through the water to the woman he loves. CHARLIE (cont'd) Tess! With four steps, Charlie is there. He reaches to take Tes his arms, but stops, horrified. CHARLIE’S POV: It is not Tess. The dark shape was a sail a trick of the shadows. CUT TO: Charlie. He is starting to panic. UNDERWATER SHOT: Charlie plunges beneath the water that f the cabin. Fearing the worst now, he is looking for a cor Nothing. Charlie resurfaces for air, and dives back under. CHARLIE’S UNDERWATER POV: The cabin skylight has been punctured by the ship’s boom, which, still attached to th broken mast, protrudes in from the sea at an unlikely ang The hole seems to have been enlarged to a size big enough a person to fit through. Charlie surfaces. He is still for a moment, trying to understand what it means. And with a huge lung-full of air, plunges back under he water. Dawn, slanting down through the shifting sea, makes the broken skylight seem like the entrance to a bright, white light-filled tunnel. Charlie swims out of the cabin window, and into the light Charlie is now back under the open sea, but on the island side of Querencia's hull. The broken mast is jammed into rocks at the base of the island. Charlie swims past a mess of twisted rigging, searching f sign of Tess. He looks up toward the sunlight. He can see the outline o the island flickering above him.  102. He kicks hard for the surface, but moves only a few inche He tries to move again, but cannot. He glances around, tr to find what is holding him. CLOSE ON: Charlie’s pullover is snagged on some broken rigging. Charlie twists, trying to unhook himself. He cannot. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He has been submerged a long time now. breath is starting to run out. More and more desperately, Charlie twists, and struggles. He tries to take the pullover off, but it tangles around Bubbles escape from his mouth, he cannot hold on any long He screws his eyes tight with the effort of holding the s air inside his bursting lungs. And then... To his great surprise, Charlie is suddenly pulled free by unseen hands. He rips out of the jumper and shoots to the surface. BANG! Breaking the surface, Charlie gratefully gulps air. looks around expectantly for his savior:

Tink..? Tink are you..? But Charlie’s alone. Charlie doesn’t understand...B ut then he thinks he does...and he smiles gratefully. On one side, the upturned hull of Querencia blocks Charli view of Tink’s boat. On the other side, is the island. Charlie, barely conscious, struggles to his feet. His eye hardly able to focus, search the rough black rock. And th he sees it...a flash of orange. There! Clad in her orange survival suit, Tess lies very s amongst the rocks.
(weakly, hardly a whisper) Tess..?  103.

There are a lot of Marblehead residents gathered out here tonight to keep vigil. We see Tink, Grace, Fraffie Chapma Marge and many others... And there’s a TV crew on hand, doing a story on Tess and missing boat. The same reporter, who just interviewed Tes speaks into the camera. He seems pretty emotional.

(into camera) You can see from the number of people out here this morning, waiting, hoping for some word...just how much Tess Carroll means to her hometown of Marblehead...But it’s been over forty-eight hours now...a long time to be out there in the freezing waters of the North Atlantic, and hopes of finding Tess Carroll alive are fading...
Grace is listening to the reporter as he puts his stock concerned face on for the camera.
I should never have let her go...

(smiling) Like you could have stopped her..? (Grace smiles sadly) Now...in the b.g. on the water, unnoticed by the crowd, w can see a boat docking. We can barely make it out. Is it Tink’s? The reporter approaches Grace, mike in hand.
Mrs. Carroll, I know it’s a terrible time for you but-

This isn’t a wake, young man. My daughter is alive. Maybe you’1ll do another story on her after she sails around the world.  104. Grace turns and walks away from the reporter, leaving him looking a little foolish. Then...from behind the crowd...we just about make out a f of orange, heading slowly toward the crowd... Marge is the first to see it, she can only gasp and say:
Oh, my God! Now they all see what Marge has seen-

head_text.subj: CHARLIE CARRYING TESS IN HIS ARMS

text: Tess, in her orange survival suit, lies limp in his arms. Charlie looks near death himself as he walks slowly towar the disbelieving crowd. Within moments, Charlie’s enveloped by the throng.
(weakly) Call the hospital. Tell them...
Tink come flying out, he starts helping Charlie get the motionless Tess inside.
Tink! Is she...
I don’t know... The frenzied reporter and cameraman rush over. It’s absol chaos...

An empty corridor. Many hours have passed. Charlie’s curl up on a bench, sound asleep. There’s a blanket around him Then...two hands gently stir him awake. He opens his eyes...groggy, unfocused...But when he realizes who it is bolts upright...
Alive and well and radiantly beautiful. Charlie is amazed and absolutely overjoyed.  105.
Tess...you’re okay...?
You saved me, Charlie... Charlie pours out his heart.
It’s you who saved me. You brought me back. I’m ready to live again, Tess, and I want to be with you. (he knows now...) Tess, you're my Querencia...
(smiles ) I love you, Charlie St. Cloud... And Charlie reaches out to take her in his arms... But he can’t. TESS IS TRANSPARENT. His arms pass right through her. AND SHE’S FADING AWAY.
Tess, no...NO! But Tess isn’t frightened. She smiles as she says...
I love you... And then she’s just...gone.
No!
Charlie’s frantically rushing down the corridor, paying n heed to the passing doctors, nurses, patients...He gets t the hall marked- ICU. He’s heading in but he’s stopped by brawny MALE NURSE.
Tess Carroll. I have to-  106.
She’s no longer here. Charlie’s knees get weak. A voice behind him-
Charlie! Charlie turns around. It’s Grace Carroll, very emotional.
Mrs. Carroll..? Where’s..? And Grace starts to cry as she hugs Charlie tight
Oh, Charlie... Charlie just stands there...unable to move. Then Grace Carroll releases him. And she smiles...

It was touch and go for awhile there, Charlie...but... (near tears) ...-The doctors are saying...it’s a miracle. (Charlie smiles) She’s asking for you. INT. TESS’S HOSPITAL ROOM - EVENING Charlie walks in...There’s Tess, sitting up in bed, talki with Tink, who sees him first.
Here he is.
Tess... Tink smiles at Tess as he heads toward the door.
You need anything?
(smiling) Just to get out of here...
You’re staying put for awhile...  107. Tink pats Charlie’s back on his way out.
See you around... Grateful to be alone with her, Charlie walks to Tess’s bedside.
(smiles ) If I’d known you were going to save my life, I wouldn’t have been so mean to you.
(smiles ) When were you..?
The other night by my boat.
(smiles ) You weren't that mean...
Oh, yes, I was... (then she smiles) So tell me, Charlie St. Cloud...are you still racing? Charlie just looks at her. What’s going on here..?
Racing..? Tess—
(smiling) You were the captain of the sailing team weren’t you? Charlie gets a sinking feeling in his stomach.
Tess—
I was two years behind you in high school. And now Charlie knows for sure...Tess does not remember anything about the time they spent together...when she wa spirit.  108.
Hey...didn’t you get a scholarship to...Dartmouth, right? Charlie looks into those sea green eyes...probably, he figures, for the last time...Then...
You've got a good memory.
(laughs) Sometimes I can’t even remember what day it is...But I owe you my life, Charlie. That’s one thing I’ll never forget...
You should get some rest...
Do you have to go?
Yeah, I-
(laughs) Wait. Don’t tell me. You have to fix the sprinklers or the whole place will... Charlie just looks at her. And Tess realizes it too...
Where’d that come from..?
You don’t know?
I have no...idea... But Charlie knows. And his heart is racing. He looks into those eyes again...
“Trust your heart though the seas catch fire. And live by love...

“,..though the stars walk backward...”  109. Tess just looks at him, not fully understanding it yet, b feeling the connection, the deep bond between them...She reaches out her hand...and Charlie takes it.
Charlie walks down the street, in no particular hurry. Bu everywhere he goes, somebody seems to want to smile or wa Charlie waves back. Then-
St. Cloud! Stop right there! Charlie turns around, his blood runs cold. It’s Fraffie Chapman heading right for him.

Look, Fraffie, I- Fraffie gives him a big kiss. Charlie’s stunned. Then, ju like that...Fraffie’s gone. Charlie smiles and keeps walk INT. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE - LATE AFTERNOON Charlie’s throwing a few things in a duffle bag. Joe watc
I'll get the rest of my stuff later.
Won't be the same around here without you...So what are you gonna do?
(smiles ) I don’t know... He steps outside, then...
Maybe we can meet up at Maddie’s sometime. Grab a beer. Joe just smiles at the “new” Charlie.

Let’s see how it goes. Charlie smiles.  110. EXT. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE - SHORT TIME LATER Charlie walks toward his pickup. But then he realizes tha the sun is starting to set. He looks toward the woods at cemetery’s edge.
Charlie walks into the glade. It’s deserted. The last of light fades. He hears the sunset cannon’s blast. He smile sadly and sits down on the log:
I miss you, Sam...I miss you already... And then...a voice:
I’m right here, bro... BUT CHARLIE DOESN’T HEAR THE VOICE.

head_text.subj: THE HANDSOME YOUNG MAN, STANDING BEFORE HIM

text: It takes us a moment to realize...that it’s Sam. And he’s no longer twelve, he’s all grown up - a perfect combination of the boy he’d been and the man he’d always hoped to be.

head_text.subj: CHARLIE CAN NEITHER SEE NOR HEAR HIM...

text: I wish you could see me, Charlie...finally, as I was meant to be...You’d fall right off that log.
I broke the promise, Sam...I’m sorry... Sam kneels down to Charlie.
You were right to let go. I know that now. We were holding each other back. (then) (MORE )
SAM (cont'd) Charlie...I can go anywhere, do anything...It’s beyond anything we ever imagined... Charlie gets up, walks past Sam, looks up to heavens.
You were out there with me, weren't you, Sam? You saved my life.
(smiles ) Call it a miracle. Charlie starts to cry. It breaks Sam’s heart.
Oh, Charlie...
Why does it have to hurt so bad?
(sad smile) It hurts because you love me. It hurts because you’re alive.
I just want to see you, Sam...Hang out with you and laugh...I want to play catch...
(smiling) We'll be back together in the blink of an eye. There’1ll be all the time in the world for having catches. Charlie calms down. He seems at peace now.
I love you, Sam. We'll always be brothers.
You promise?

I promise. And with that, Charlie takes his last, long look around t glade. And he starts to walk away.  112. As Sam watches him go, he reaches into his jacket pocket something... Charlie’s nearing the woods but he stops in his tracks as sees...

Rolling into his field of vision from behind. He picks th baseball up. Is he dreaming this...? He turns around. There’s nothing there. Not even Sam’s hologram. Charlie’s face lights up with the biggest smile as he tos the ball in the air and catches it. Then:
Night, Sam... And as he walks out of the glade... WE HEAR FLORIO FERRENTE’S VOICE
Tess and Charlie had to fall in love all over again...
People lining up for the Saturday night show...Tess and Charlie hand in hand in line.
They went to the movies at the Warwick... INT. MADDIE’S BAR - NIGHT Charlie turns away from the bar with two drinks in his ha brings them to a table where Tess waits. Joe is here too.
...They had one too many drinks at Maddie's.
Charlie and Tess rush out of the church where they’re pel with rice. They look deliriously happy and it seems like whole town’s turned out.  113.
They got married at the Old North Church.
Charlie carrying the laughing Tess across the threshold.

They settled down in a house on Cloutman’s Lane. EXT. MARY ALLEY HOSPITAL — DAY Charlie’s pickup screeches to a halt out front. Charlie practically falls out the door, runs around to help Tess She’s laughing hysterically.
The baby was born right here in Mary Alley Hospital...
Charlie stands there, beaming with pride as Tess lies nur their newborn baby.
They named him Sam... EXT. HOUSE ON CLOUTMAN’S LANE - DAY Charlie is teaching little Sam, age 4 to catch a baseball Tess watches from the porch.
The St. Clouds will live out their whole lives in Marblehead without even thinking about it...
Florio stands among the headstones, we recognize Sam’s, s gleaming white in the sun.
Well, that’s the end of my story...the miracle of Charlie St. Cloud. (pleased) And as it turns out, the miracle did have a purpose. (looks around) (MORE )
FLORIO (cont'd) Someday Charlie...well, he’1l come back here to Waterside. (smiles ) But for now...

head_text.subj: CHARLIE, TESS AND YOUNG SAM ON A SAILBOAT

text: Heading off for a sail around Marblehead.
-.-He’s got some sailing to do.

head_text.subj: BACK TO FLORIO ON THE BLUFF

text: Watching Charlie and Tess and little Sam... Then Florio turns toward the woods. As he begins to walk, slowly becomes more and more transparent...and finally fa away. We're left with a pristine view of Marblehead harbor...an sailboat...Charlie and Tess’s boat with sail full...going with the wind.
